_header: I see a ribbon rich and new
Subjects: heaven, joys of; advice, spiritual; visions
_description: Man for the Better Abyde — seven 8-line stanzas

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
I see a Rybane Ryche and neweWyth stones and perles Ryally
                    pyght…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…And brynge vs to þe blysse of heuenffor the better ther
                    euer to a byde
BlCottCalAII.Note:
‘Explicit’ by scribe in lower margin f.
                    67v.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
ffor þe better a byde (by scribe, upper margin f. 67); Another poeme
                    for the Better abide (f. 1, sixteenth-century list of contents)
BlCottCalAII.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard,
                        ed.  
             A Selection from the Minor Poems of Don John Lydgate.
Percy Society
         2. London: T. Richard, 1840: 222-4.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 283-4.

Banna.First Lines:
I saw ane rob riche of hewWith pretius stanis peirles
                    picht…
Banna.Last Lines:
…To bring ws to the bliss of hevinffor þair
                    quhair we mot for now & evir abyd
